definition: to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
decree to grant a special pardon
Amnesty International/same as 大赦國際

pinyin: Guo2 ji4 Te4 she4 Zu3 zhi1

sentences.english: But, history prove less pardons in brilliant times, more pardons in troubled times.
sentences.chinese: 盛世时赦少，乱世赦多也是历史所证明的。

sentences.english: To give knowledge of salvation unto his people by the remission of their sins
sentences.chinese: 叫他的百姓因罪得赦，就知到救恩。

sentences.english: And when he saw their faith, he said unto him, Man, thy sins are forgiven thee.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣见他们的信心，就对瘫子说，你的罪赦了。

sentences.english: For this is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.
sentences.chinese: 因为这是我立约的血，为多人流出来，使罪得赦。

sentences.english: The decrees for pardon that are written before and in early Tang Dynasty mainly act as judicature.
sentences.chinese: 唐代以前以及唐初的赦文，其功能在于司法。

sentences.english: When Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the sick of the palsy, Son, thy sins be forgiven thee.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣见他们的信心，就对瘫子说，小子，你的罪赦了。

sentences.english: Now where there is a remission of these, there is no more an oblation for sin.
sentences.chinese: 若这些罪已经赦了，也就用不著赎罪的祭献了。

sentences.english: If you have any regrets we can pardon him at once.
sentences.chinese: 皇后如后悔，朕现在就赦了他。

sentences.english: The decrees for pardon that are delivered during Wu Zetian's rule begin to experience great changes.
sentences.chinese: 在武则天时期所颁布的赦文中开始出现了重大的变化。

sentences.english: The time for Jiang to follow Zhou was after Zhou Emperor of the Shang Dynasty released Wen Emperor.
sentences.chinese: 姜太公归周的时间应在商纣赦文王以后。

sentences.english: This guy is probably very dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 他很可能是个无恶不赦的家伙。

definition: to put (a criminal) to death/to punish
to pardon/to absolve/to exempt from punishment
to admit to a crime/to plead guilty
